channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: Nearly 58 billion personal data points have been leaked online since 2004, new study reveals
item.description: Your digital life is more exposed than you think. A new study from security firm Surfshark has quantified the astonishing scale of data breaches since 2004, revealing that tens of billions of personal data points, from passwords to physical addresses, are now in the wild.
item.dc:creator: Rene Millman, TechRadar

item.title: Gartner: AI budgets are going to projects that demonstrate value, real-world impact
item.description: Many infrastructure and operations leaders aren’t able to dig out enough money from budgets to reallocate to AI projects, Gartner said in a survey released this week. The research firm surveyed 253 IT leaders globally, and the budget issue plagued half the participants.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: It was the hottest thing in climate tech. Now it’s trapped in the valley of death
item.description: A year ago, direct air capture—technology that pulls CO2 from the air—seemed ready to quickly scale in the U.S. Project Cypress, a massive undertaking in Louisiana designed to capture more than a million tons of CO2 each year, won $50 million in funding from the Department of Energy in early 2024.
item.dc:creator: Adele Peters, Fast Company

item.title: NASA tests low-volume supersonic jet that could slash air travel time
item.description: NASA and Lockheed Martin debuted their first test run of a low-volume supersonic jet that’s expected to allow air passengers to travel faster than the speed of sound. The X-59 aircraft soared Tuesday from Lockheed Martin’s facility in Palmdale, Calif.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, The Hill

item.title: I went to the launch of the Prusa Core One L - and the impressive scale of this 3D printer sets a benchmark for the future
item.description: A new era in 3D printing is fast approaching and the latest Core One L refines CoreXY Kinematics to offer a larger print area in box only marginally larger than the original.
item.dc:creator: Alastair Jennings, TechRadar

item.title: Nike partners with robotics company to create world's first motor-powered footwear system
item.description: Nike unveils Project Amplify, revolutionary motorized shoes developed with Dephy that add powered assistance to every step for runners and walkers.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Google, YouTube settle for $30M over allegations of collecting kids' personal data
item.description: The lawsuit alleged data was collected from children watching cartoons and nursery rhymes on YouTube.
item.dc:creator: Ben Mitchell, NewsNation

item.title: NotebookLM just got a major chat upgrade with 8x more context, better memory, and smarter responses
item.description: Google is embedding its Nano Banana AI image model into Search and NotebookLM, with Photos to follow.
item.dc:creator: Eric Hal Schwartz, TechRadar

item.title: Separating fact from fiction: Samsung Galaxy for enterprise security
item.description: Let’s bust some myths. In enterprise security, mobile devices are both a driver of innovation and a frequent source of misconceptions.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: Apple delivers strong quarter despite trade war challenges and ongoing artificial technology issues
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Apple delivered financial results during its summertime quarter that exceeded analyst projections, despite being caught in the crosshairs of a global trade war at the same time the trendsetting company is scrambling to catch up to its Big Tech peers in the artificial intelligenc
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Young T. rex or a new dinosaur? New bones add to the debate
item.description: Scientists say there’s new evidence that settles the origins of a mysterious dinosaur excavated in the 1940s.
item.dc:creator: Adithi Ramakrishnan, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Universal Music and AI song tool Udio settle lawsuit and partner on new platform, sparking backlash
item.description: LONDON (AP) — Universal Music Group and AI song generation platform Udio have settled a copyright infringement lawsuit and agreed to team up on new music creation and streaming platform, the two companies said in a joint announcement.
item.dc:creator: KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Microsoft Forms cheat sheet: How to get started
item.description: Microsoft Forms is a web app that allows users to create various types of forms that gather information from people online and store that data in the cloud for review. Why is this useful? Surveys, questionnaires, and other interactive forms are a vital part of doing business.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Meta shares slide after company projects higher expenses for 2026
item.description: Meta's stock slid in after-hours trading on Wednesday after the tech giant posted strong third-quarter results but warned that its expenses will be significantly higher in 2026 than this year. Like its rivals, Meta Platforms Inc.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Google's corporate parent posts first-ever quarter with $100B in revenue in latest show of its power
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Google’s corporate parent on Wednesday announced its first-ever quarter with more than $100 billion in revenue, a milestone that illustrates the unwavering power of its internet empire amid legal and competitive threats. The news of Alphabet Inc.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: Microsoft deploys a fix to Azure cloud service that's hit with outage
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Microsoft has deployed a fix to address an outage of their Azure cloud portal that left users unable to access Office 365, Minecraft and other services.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: DHS attacks Washington Post over report on misleading footage of immigration operations
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) attacked The Washington Post over a report about footage of immigration operations the outlet characterized as misleading.
item.dc:creator: Tara Suter, The Hill

item.title: Wild Moose emerges from stealth mode with site reliability platform
item.description: Wild Moose, a startup that recently exited stealth mode, has secured $7 million in seed funding for its AI-powered site reliability engineering (SRE) platform. The platform acts as an SRE copilot, helping IT teams investigate incidents and reduce mean time to repair (MTTR).
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Character.AI is banning minors from interacting with its chatbots
item.description: Character.AI is banning minors from using its chatbots amid growing concerns about the effects of artificial intelligence conversations on children.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: A company that went from startup to program-of-the-year winner through AI innovation
item.description: "You always start with the people, having good members within your team that are always thinking ahead," Alexander Granados said. The post A company that went from startup to program-of-the-year winner through AI innovation first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gerton, Federal News Network

item.title: Phony AI-generated videos of Hurricane Melissa flood social media sites
item.description: One viral video shows what appears to be four sharks swimming in a Jamaican hotel's pool as floodwaters allegedly brought on by Hurricane Melissa swamp the area. Another purportedly depicts Jamaica's Kingston airport completely ravaged by the storm.
item.dc:creator: TAIMOOR SOBHAN and KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Apple Watch Series 11: The things you don’t see
item.description: While there were solid improvements in the last generation of Apple’s popular wearable, the huge 24-hour battery life in Apple Watch Series 11 means this smartwatch has finally become what it always promised to be: a device capable of running all day and all night, which is especially for tasks like
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Nvidia becomes world’s first $5 trillion company
item.description: Nvidia on Wednesday became the first company in the world to reach a $5 trillion valuation. The chipmaker’s stock jumped 3 percent at market open, pushing the company above the historic milestone.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: Cisco, Nvidia strengthen AI ties with new data center switch, reference architectures
item.description: Cisco and Nvidia are ramping up their partnership, and the latest deliverables include the new Cisco N9100 series data center switch built on Nvidia’s Spectrum-X Ethernet switch silicon.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Big Tech rethinking human workforce amid AI push
item.description: The World Economic Forum predicts 92 million jobs could be lost by 2030 — but another 170 million jobs could be created.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Bass, NewsNation

item.title: AI truck system matches top human drivers in massive safety showdown with perfect scores
item.description: Kodiak Driver autonomous truck achieves perfect 98 safety score, matching top human fleets in groundbreaking AI evaluation by Nauto's VERA system.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: The top 4 JVM languages and why developers love them
item.description: The Java virtual machine provides a high-performance, universal runtime for a wealth of popular languages beyond just Java. In this article, we’ll look at the characteristic strengths and common use cases of four of the most popular JVM languages: Kotlin, Scala, Groovy, and Clojure.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Startup giving away 3 billion free ads to help US businesses
item.description: Australian startup Cuttable is looking to change the landscape of e-commerce advertising in the United States.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Djordjevic, NewsNation

item.title: Nvidia looks to power AI factory networks
item.description: Networking technology took center stage at Nvidia’s GTC DC developers show in Washington, D.C. as a range of networking products were introduced for high-performance AI inference processing and more.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Musk launches Grokipedia, AI-powered alternative to Wikipedia
item.description: Elon Musk launched Grokipedia on Monday as an alternative to the nonprofit-powered Wikipedia. Musk’s version is backed by xAI but still uses Wikipedia as a source on most subjects.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, The Hill

item.title: OpenAI completes restructuring, signs new agreement with Microsoft
item.description: OpenAI has completed a restructuring of the company, converting its for-profit arm into a public benefit corporation and giving its nonprofit a controlling stake, the ChatGPT maker announced Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: Elon Musk launches AI Grokipedia to compete with Wikipedia
item.description: The site comes after conservatives have criticized Wikipedia for exclouding some conservative outlets from its list of reputable sources.
item.dc:creator: Steph Whiteside, NewsNation

item.title: Stragglers from Myanmar scam center raided by army cross into Thailand as buildings are blown up
item.description: BANGKOK (AP) — The number of people fleeing from Myanmar to Thailand after Myanmar’s military shut down a major online scam center has slowed to a trickle, a Thai regional army commander said Tuesday, after more than 1,500 had left in the past week.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: New military age demands new C2 comms
item.description: As purposely scattered forces replace massing, all units need access to rich and latency-free crucial situational data regardless of from where they operate. The post New military age demands new C2 comms first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Tom Temin, Federal News Network
